pullRequest.body:
Co-authored-by: Kyle Miller <kmill31415@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3e6c8736d4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22048/commits/3e6c8736d47aecf0f57b474125d04c0105046921)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Lightly tested:
```lean
private inductive FinsetResult where
  | finset (s : Term)
  | univ
  | filter (s : Term) (p : Term)

/-- Delaborates a finset. In case it is a `Finset.filter`, `i` is used for the binder name. -/
private def delabFinsetArg (i : Ident) :
    DelabM FinsetResult := do
  let s ‚Üê getExpr
  if s.isAppOfArity ``Finset.univ 2 then
    return .univ
  else if s.isAppOfArity ``Finset.filter 4 then
    let ss ‚Üê withNaryArg 3 delab
    withNaryArg 1 do
      if (‚Üê getExpr).isLambda then
        withBindingBody i.getId do
          let p ‚Üê delab
          return .filter ss p
      else
        let p ‚Üê delab
        return .filter ss (‚Üê `($p $i))
  else
    let ss ‚Üê delab
    return .finset ss

/-- Delaborator for `Finset.prod`. The `pp.piBinderTypes` option controls whether
to show the domain type when the product is over `Finset.univ`. -/
@[app_delab Finset.prod] def delabFinsetProd : Delab :=
  whenPPOption getPPNotation <| withOverApp 5 <| do
  let #[_, _, _, _, f] := (‚Üê getExpr).getAppArgs | failure
  guard <| f.isLambda
  let ppDomain ‚Üê getPPOption getPPPiBinderTypes
  let (i, body) ‚Üê withAppArg <| withBindingBodyUnusedName fun i => do
    return ((‚ü®i‚ü© : Ident), ‚Üê delab)
  let res ‚Üê withNaryArg 3 <| delabFinsetArg i
  match res with
  | .finset ss => `(‚àè $i:ident ‚àà $ss, $body)
  | .univ =>
    let binder ‚Üê
    if ppDomain then
      let ty ‚Üê withNaryArg 0 delab
      `(bigOpBinder| $i:ident : $ty)
    else
      `(bigOpBinder| $i:ident)
    `(‚àè $binder:bigOpBinder, $body)
  | .filter ss p =>
    `(‚àè $i:ident ‚àà $ss with $p, $body)

/-- Delaborator for `Finset.sum`. The `pp.piBinderTypes` option controls whether
to show the domain type when the sum is over `Finset.univ`. -/
@[app_delab Finset.sum] def delabFinsetSum : Delab :=
  whenPPOption getPPNotation <| withOverApp 5 <| do
  let #[_, _, _, _, f] := (‚Üê getExpr).getAppArgs | failure
  guard <| f.isLambda
  let ppDomain ‚Üê getPPOption getPPPiBinderTypes
  let (i, body) ‚Üê withAppArg <| withBindingBodyUnusedName fun i => do
    return ((‚ü®i‚ü© : Ident), ‚Üê delab)
  let res ‚Üê withNaryArg 3 <| delabFinsetArg i
  match res with
  | .finset ss => `(‚àë $i:ident ‚àà $ss, $body)
  | .univ =>
    let binder ‚Üê
    if ppDomain then
      let ty ‚Üê withNaryArg 0 delab
      `(bigOpBinder| $i:ident : $ty)
    else
      `(bigOpBinder| $i:ident)
    `(‚àë $binder:bigOpBinder, $body)
  | .filter ss p =>
    `(‚àë $i:ident ‚àà $ss with $p, $body)
```
This prints `sum (filter s fun x ‚Ü¶ p x) fun x ‚Ü¶ f x` as `‚àë x ‚àà univ with p x, f x` instead of `‚àë x with p x, f x`, but thank you! I'll take it from there.
This looks reasonable and the tests show it behaves as it should, so I'm happy with this, but let's see if @kmill or @eric-wieser have thoughts
Can we have some tests for this? I'm guessing guard_msgs with #check is the best way
I don't think these test delaboration: they all succeed without this PR!

I was thinking more like
```
/-- info: ‚àë i : Œπ, f i : M -/
#guard_msgs in
#check Finset.sum Finset.univ fun i ‚Ü¶ f i
```
which does succeed without it, and
```
/-- info: ‚àë i ‚àà s with p i, f i -/
#guard_msgs in
#check Finset.sum {i ‚àà s | p i} fun i ‚Ü¶ f i
```
which does not. (And of course the other 6 versions you've already identified)
Ah yes of course ü§¶

Can we also test for what happens with other binder names, since those are explicitly mentioned in the doc for `delabFinsetArg`. That is, how does
```
Finset.sum {j | p j} fun k ‚Ü¶ f k
```
get delaborated?
The function gets the priority
(I'm aware and I'm saying the test should be aware too!)
Yes, so they do now? What do you mean?
I'm saying that you answered the question but the question wasn't to you :)
It looks like we don't need this, right?
Oh indeed, not anymore
I think this is also unused?
This doesn't seem quite accurate, it's specifically interpreting an expression as one of the four specific forms, rather than doing general finset delaboration, right?
What about now?
Let's test for the behaviour with piBinderTypes on/off. I also think the option should control what happens in the filterUniv case, in the same way as it does here (and that should be tested too)

```suggestion
/-! ### Big operators over a fintype with `piBinderTypes` on -/
```

```suggestion
/-! ### Big operators over a fintype with `piBinderTypes` off -/
```

pullRequest.title: feat: delaborator for `‚àë x ‚àà s with p x, f x` notation

Lightly tested:
```lean
private inductive FinsetResult where

  | univ
  | filter (s : Term) (p : Term)

/-- Delaborates a finset. In case it is a `Finset.filter`, `i` is used for the binder name. -/

    return .univ
  else if s.isAppOfArity ``Finset.filter 4 then
    let ss ‚Üê withNaryArg 3 delab

        withBindingBody i.getId do

          return .filter ss p
      else

  else

/-- Delaborator for `Finset.prod`. The `pp.piBinderTypes` option controls whether
to show the domain type when the product is over `Finset.univ`. -/
@[app_delab Finset.prod] def delabFinsetProd : Delab :=
  whenPPOption getPPNotation <| withOverApp 5 <| do
  let #[_, _, _, _, f] := (‚Üê getExpr).getAppArgs | failure
  guard <| f.isLambda
  let ppDomain ‚Üê getPPOption getPPPiBinderTypes
  let (i, body) ‚Üê withAppArg <| withBindingBodyUnusedName fun i => do
    return ((‚ü®i‚ü© : Ident), ‚Üê delab)
  let res ‚Üê withNaryArg 3 <| delabFinsetArg i
  match res with
  | .finset ss => `(‚àè $i:ident ‚àà $ss, $body)
  | .univ =>
    let binder ‚Üê
    if ppDomain then
      let ty ‚Üê withNaryArg 0 delab
      `(bigOpBinder| $i:ident : $ty)
    else
      `(bigOpBinder| $i:ident)
    `(‚àè $binder:bigOpBinder, $body)
  | .filter ss p =>
    `(‚àè $i:ident ‚àà $ss with $p, $body)

/-- Delaborator for `Finset.sum`. The `pp.piBinderTypes` option controls whether
to show the domain type when the sum is over `Finset.univ`. -/
@[app_delab Finset.sum] def delabFinsetSum : Delab :=
  whenPPOption getPPNotation <| withOverApp 5 <| do
  let #[_, _, _, _, f] := (‚Üê getExpr).getAppArgs | failure
  guard <| f.isLambda
  let ppDomain ‚Üê getPPOption getPPPiBinderTypes
  let (i, body) ‚Üê withAppArg <| withBindingBodyUnusedName fun i => do
    return ((‚ü®i‚ü© : Ident), ‚Üê delab)
  let res ‚Üê withNaryArg 3 <| delabFinsetArg i
  match res with
  | .finset ss => `(‚àë $i:ident ‚àà $ss, $body)
  | .univ =>
    let binder ‚Üê
    if ppDomain then
      let ty ‚Üê withNaryArg 0 delab
      `(bigOpBinder| $i:ident : $ty)
    else
      `(bigOpBinder| $i:ident)
    `(‚àë $binder:bigOpBinder, $body)
  | .filter ss p =>
    `(‚àë $i:ident ‚àà $ss with $p, $body)
```
This prints `sum (filter s fun x ‚Ü¶ p x) fun x ‚Ü¶ f x` as `‚àë x ‚àà univ with p x, f x` instead of `‚àë x with p x, f x`, but thank you! I'll take it from there.
